Boolean_Value_Mismatch.description: This column appears to contain boolean (True/False) data, but unexpected values were found. This could indicate inconsistent coding for the same intended values, potentially leading to downstream errors or inconsistent business logic.
Boolean_Value_Mismatch.name: Unexpected Boolean Values Found
Boolean_Value_Mismatch.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether this data needs to be corrected.

Char_Column_Date_Values.description: This column is defined as alpha, but more than 95% of its values are dates. Dates in alpha columns might not sort correctly, and might contradict user expectations downstream. It's also possible that more than one type of information is stored in the column, making it harder to retrieve.
Char_Column_Date_Values.name: Character Column with Mostly Date Values
Char_Column_Date_Values.suggested_action: Review your source data and ingestion process. Consider whether it might be better to store the date values as a date or datetime column. If the alpha data is also significant, you could store it in a different column.

Char_Column_Number_Units.description: This column is defined as alpha, but values include numbers with percents or common units. Embedded measures in alpha columns are harder to access, won't sort correctly, and might contradict user expectations downstream. Consider parsing into numeric and UOM columns to improve usability.
Char_Column_Number_Units.name: Character Column with Numbers and Units
Char_Column_Number_Units.suggested_action: Review your source data and ingestion process. Consider whether it might be better to parse the numeric and unit data and store in separate columns.

Char_Column_Number_Values.description: This column is defined as alpha, but more than 95% of its values are numeric. Numbers in alpha columns won't sort correctly, and might contradict user expectations downstream. It's also possible that more than one type of information is stored in the column, making it harder to retrieve.
Char_Column_Number_Values.name: Character Column with Mostly Numeric Values
Char_Column_Number_Values.suggested_action: Review your source data and ingestion process. Consider whether it might be better to store the numeric data in a numeric column. If the alpha data is significant, you could store it in a different column.

Column_Pattern_Mismatch.description: Alpha-numeric string data within this column conforms to 2-4 different patterns, with 95% matching the first pattern. This could indicate data errors in the remaining values.
Column_Pattern_Mismatch.name: Pattern Inconsistency Within Column
Column_Pattern_Mismatch.suggested_action: Review the values for any data that doesn't conform to the most common pattern and correct any data errors.

Delimited_Data_Embedded.description: Delimited data, separated by a common delimiter (comma, tab, pipe or caret) is present in over 80% of column values. This could indicate data that was incorrectly ingested, or data that would be better represented in parsed form.
Delimited_Data_Embedded.name: Delimited Data Embedded in Column
Delimited_Data_Embedded.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data consumers to determine the most useful representation of this data.

Inconsistent_Casing.description: Casing is inconsistent for a column representing an entity name or address elements. Mixed-Case and All-Upper-Case values were found in the same column.
Inconsistent_Casing.name: Inconsistent Casing
Inconsistent_Casing.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether consistent casing should be applied at the source. If source data corrections are not possible, consider standardizing the column upon ingestion to ensure consistent casing.

Invalid_Zip3_USA.description: The majority of values in this column are 3-digit zips, but divergent patterns were found. This could indicate an incorrect roll-up category or a PII concern.
Invalid_Zip3_USA.name: Invalid USA ZIP-3 Format
Invalid_Zip3_USA.suggested_action: Review your source data, ingestion process, and any processing steps that update this column.

Invalid_Zip_USA.description: Some values present do not conform with the expected format of USA Zip Codes.
Invalid_Zip_USA.name: Invalid USA Zip Code Format
Invalid_Zip_USA.suggested_action: Consider correcting invalid column values or changing them to indicate a missing value if corrections cannot be made.

Leading_Spaces.description: Spaces were found before data at the front of column string values. This likely contradicts user expectations and could be a sign of broader ingestion or processing errors.
Leading_Spaces.name: Leading Spaces Found in Column Values
Leading_Spaces.suggested_action: Review your source data, ingestion process, and any processing steps that update this column.

Multiple_Types_Major.description: Columns with the same name have broadly different types across tables. Differences could be significant enough to cause errors in downstream analysis, extra steps resulting in divergent business logic and inconsistencies in results.
Multiple_Types_Major.name: Multiple Data Types per Column Name - Major
Multiple_Types_Major.suggested_action: Ideally, you should change the column data types to be fully consistent. If the data is meant to be different, you should change column names so downstream users aren't led astray.

Multiple_Types_Minor.description: Columns with the same name have the same general type across tables, but the types do not exactly match. Truncation issues may result if columns are commingled and assumed to be the same format.
Multiple_Types_Minor.name: Multiple Data Types per Column Name - Minor
Multiple_Types_Minor.suggested_action: Consider changing the column data types to be fully consistent. This will tighten your standards at ingestion and assure that data is consistent between tables.

No_Values.description: This column is present in the table, but no values have been ingested or assigned in any records. This could indicate missing data or a processing error. Note that this considers dummy values and zero-length values as missing data.
No_Values.name: No Column Values Present
No_Values.suggested_action: Review your source data, ingestion process, and any processing steps that update this column.

Non_Alpha_Name_Address.description: Entirely non-alphabetic values were found in a column representing an entity name or address element.
Non_Alpha_Name_Address.name: Non-Alpha Name or Address
Non_Alpha_Name_Address.suggested_action: Non-alphabetic values are highly likely to be invalid for this kind of column. This may indicate a file format change, error in an ingestion process, or incorrect source data. Review your pipeline process and source data to determine the root-cause. If this data accurately reflects source data, and upstream corrections are not possible, consider assigning the processed value to null to reflect that data is missing.

Non_Alpha_Prefixed_Name.description: Non-alphabetic characters were found at the start of a column representing an entity name.
Non_Alpha_Prefixed_Name.name: Non-Alpha Prefixed Name
Non_Alpha_Prefixed_Name.suggested_action: Values starting with a non-alphabetic character are highly likely to be invalid for this kind of column. This may indicate a file format change, error in an ingestion process, or incorrect source data. It could also indicate flagging or coding of some kind that can be broken out in a separate column in processed data. Review your pipeline process and source data to determine the root-cause. If this data accurately reflects source data, and upstream corrections are not possible, consider applying corrections directly to processed data where possible.

Non_Printing_Chars.description: Non-printing characters were found embedded in a text column.
Non_Printing_Chars.name: Non-Printing Characters
Non_Printing_Chars.suggested_action: Embedded non-printing characters are typically stripped from data. They affect filters and aggregations, and may cause problems for downstream users who don't recognize their presence. Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether this data can be corrected upstream. If not, strip these characters from processed data.

Non_Standard_Blanks.description: Values representing missing data may be unexpected or inconsistent. Non-standard values may include empty strings as opposed to nulls, dummy entries such as "MISSING" or repeated characters that may have been used to bypass entry requirements, processing artifacts such as "NULL", or spreadsheet artifacts such as "NA", "ERROR".
Non_Standard_Blanks.name: Non-Standard Blank Values
Non_Standard_Blanks.suggested_action: Consider cleansing the column upon ingestion to replace all variants of missing data with a standard designation, like Null.

Potential_Duplicates.description: This column is largely unique, but some duplicate values are present. This pattern is uncommon and could indicate inadvertant duplication.
Potential_Duplicates.name: Potential Duplicate Values Found
Potential_Duplicates.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether this data needs to be corrected.

Potential_PII.description: This column contains data that could be Personally Identifiable Information (PII)
Potential_PII.dq_score_risk_factor: CASE LEFT(p.pii_flag, 1) WHEN 'A' THEN 1 WHEN 'B' THEN 0.66 WHEN 'C' THEN 0.33 END
Potential_PII.name: Personally Identifiable Information
Potential_PII.suggested_action: PII may require steps to ensure data security and compliance with relevant privacy regulations and legal requirements. You may have to classify and inventory PII, implement appropriate access controls, encrypt data, and monitor for unauthorized access. Your organization might be required to update privacy policies and train staff on data protection practices. Note that PII that is lower-risk in isolation might be high-risk in conjunction with other data.

Quoted_Values.description: Column values were found within quotes. This likely contradicts user expectations and could be a sign of broader ingestion or processing errors.
Quoted_Values.name: Quoted Values Found in Column Values
Quoted_Values.suggested_action: Review your source data, ingestion process, and any processing steps that update this column.

Recency_One_Year.description: Among all date columns present in the table, none fall inside of one year from Profile date.
Recency_One_Year.name: Recency - No Table Dates within 1 Year
Recency_One_Year.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether dates in table should be more recent.

Recency_Six_Months.description: Among all date columns present in the table, the most recent date falls 6 months to 1 year back from Profile date.
Recency_Six_Months.name: Recency - No Table Dates within 6 Months
Recency_Six_Months.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether dates in table should be more recent.

Small Divergent Value Ct.description: Under 3% of values in this column were found to be different from the most common value. This could indicate a data error.
Small Divergent Value Ct.name: Small Percentage of Divergent Values Found
Small Divergent Value Ct.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether this data needs to be corrected.

Small Missing Value Ct.description: Under 3% of values in this column were found to be null, zero-length or dummy values, but values are not universally present. This could indicate unexpected missing values in a required column.
Small Missing Value Ct.name: Small Percentage of Missing Values Found
Small Missing Value Ct.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether this data needs to be corrected, supplemented or excluded.

Small_Numeric_Value_Ct.description: A small fraction (under 3%) of values in this column were found to be numeric. They could be erroneous.
Small_Numeric_Value_Ct.name: Unexpected Numeric Values Found
Small_Numeric_Value_Ct.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether numeric values are invalid entries here.

Standardized_Value_Matches.description: When column values are standardized (removing spaces, single-quotes, periods and dashes), matching values are found in other records. This may indicate that formats should be further standardized to allow consistent comparisons for merges, joins and roll-ups. It could also indicate the presence of unintended duplicates.
Standardized_Value_Matches.name: Similar Values Match When Standardized
Standardized_Value_Matches.suggested_action: Review standardized vs. raw data values for all matches. Correct data if values should be consistent.

Suggested_Type.description: Data stored as text all meets criteria for a more suitable type.
Suggested_Type.name: Suggested Data Type
Suggested_Type.suggested_action: Consider changing the column data type to tighte n controls over data ingested and to make values more efficient, consistent and suitable for downstream analysis.

Table_Pattern_Mismatch.description: Alpha-numeric string data within this column matches a single pattern, but other columns with the same name have data that matches a different single pattern. Inconsistent formatting may contradict user assumptions and cause downstream errors, extra steps and inconsistent business logic.
Table_Pattern_Mismatch.name: Pattern Inconsistency Across Tables
Table_Pattern_Mismatch.suggested_action: Review the profiled patterns for the same column in other tables. You may want to add a hygiene step to your processing to make patterns consistent.

Unexpected Emails.description: This column is not labeled as email, but contains mostly email addresses. This could indicate shifted or switched source data columns.
Unexpected Emails.name: Unexpected Column Contains Emails
Unexpected Emails.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether column should be populated with email addresses.

Unexpected US States.description: This column is not labeled as a state, but contains mostly US State abbreviations. This could indicate shifted or switched source data columns.
Unexpected US States.name: Unexpected Column Contains US States
Unexpected US States.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether column should be populated with US states.

Unlikely_Date_Values.description: Some date values in this column are earlier than 1900-01-01 or later than 30 years after Profiling date.
Unlikely_Date_Values.name: Unlikely Dates out of Typical Range
Unlikely_Date_Values.suggested_action: Review your source data and follow-up with data owners to determine whether this data needs to be corrected or removed.

Variant_Coded_Values.description: This column contains more than one common variants that represent a single value or state. This can occur when data is integrated from multiple sources with different standards, or when free entry is permitted without validation. The variations can cause confusion and error for downstream data users and multiple versions of the truth.
Variant_Coded_Values.name: Variant Codings for Same Values
Variant_Coded_Values.suggested_action: Review your source data and ingestion process. Consider cleansing this data to standardize on a single set of definitive codes.
